Key Match Events: The Clippers had a winning debut at their new home, the Intuit Dome, as they torched the Mavericks 110-96 on Monday.
The Mavericks had turnover troubles with Thompson accounting for four of them.
The side had 15 of them in the first half.
They were also outscored 34-20 in the paint as the Clippers' offense turned up with all 10 players in their rotation in the points column.
Quentin Grimes had a field day for the Mavericks with 20 points, four rebounds, and, two assists.
Terance Mann and James Harden had six and 10 points, respectively, as the Clippers led the Mavericks 56-51 at halftime.
Harden ended his evening with 12 assists before resting it out in the fourth quarter.
The Mavericks had a comeback attempt in the second half as they tallied 24 points in the third quarter compared to LA's 27.
Pre-Game Insights: The onus was on Klay Thompson to lead the side with Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving being rested.
However, the four-time NBA champion went scoreless.
Thompson recorded three rebounds and one assist in the first half.
The second half saw the Mavericks attempt a comeback as they tallied 24 points in the third quarter compared to LA's 27.
The seasoned forward continued to struggle as he went scoreless in the third stretch as well.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mavericks will now hope to finish their final preseason game against the Milwaukee Bucks with a win on Thursday, while Thompson will look to put his torrid shooting struggle behind him.
Dallas' damp evening was highlighted by questionable defense and shooting struggles.
They were thoroughly outplayed by the Clippers team on both ends of the floor.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The LA Clippers play their final preseason skirmish against the Sacramento Kings at Intuit Dome on Thursday while the Mavericks host the Milwaukee Bucks in their final tune-up game on the same day as well.
The Clippers had a winning debut at their new home, the Intuit Dome.

Dallas Mavericks DNP: Luka Doncic, Kyrie Irving, Kessler Edwards, Dante Exum, Maxi Kleber, AJ Lawson, Emanuel Miller, Markief Morris and Dwight Powell.
LA Clippers DNP: Mo Bamba, Nate Darling, Trentyn Flowers, Elijah Harkless, Bones Hyland, Braxton Key, Kawhi Leonard and PJ Tucker.
